text: Jean Harlow (born Harlean Harlow Carpenter; March 3, 1911 â€“ June 7, 1937) was an American actress and sex symbol of the 1930s. ==Life== Harlow was born on March 3, 1911 in Kansas City, Missouri. She studied at Miss Barstow's Finishing School for Girls in Kansas City. Harlow was married to Charles McGrew in 1927. They divorced in 1930. On July 2, 1932, she married film producer Paul Bern, who committed suicide on September 5, 1932. ===Personal life=== On September 13, 1933 she married Harold Rosson. They divorced on March 11, 1934. She had no children. ===Death=== She died at the age 26 from renal failure on June 7, 1937 in Los Angeles, California.Obituary Variety Obituaries, June 9, 1937, page 54. ==Other websites== * * * * Jean Harlow tribute site * * Photographs and literature Category:1911 births Category:1937 deaths Category:American stage actors Category:Deaths from renal failure Category:American television actors Category:American silent movie actors Category:Actors from Kansas City, Missouri Category:Disease-related deaths in Los Angeles ==References==
title: Jean Harlow
